title: Gil Shohat
text:
Gil Shohat (, born 7 September 1973) is an Israeli classical music <a href="composer">composer</a>, <a href="Conducting">conductor</a>, <a href="pianist">pianist</a> and lecturer.
Biography.
Gil Shohat was born in Tel Aviv. His mother is "<a href="Ha%27aretz">Ha'aretz</a>" theatre critic Tzipora (Tzipi) Shohat. He grew up in Ramat Gan. As a child, he attended a music program for gifted children at <a href="Tel%20Aviv%20University">Tel Aviv University</a>. His father is an Iraqi Jew. He earned his BM and MM from the <a href="Buchmann-Mehta%20School%20of%20Music">Buchmann-Mehta School of Music</a> at Tel Aviv University in 1991-1995. In 1995-1997, he studied piano and composition at the <a href="Accademia%20Nazionale%20di%20Santa%20Cecilia">Accademia Nazionale di Santa Cecilia</a> in Rome, and the following year studied with <a href="Alexander%20Goehr">Alexander Goehr</a> of Cambridge University. Shohat lives in <a href="Jaffa">Jaffa</a> with his life partner.
Music career.
His first orchestral work was performed by the <a href="Israel%20Chamber%20Orchestra">Israel Chamber Orchestra</a> when he was 18. In the army, he served as commander of the <a href="Israel%20Defense%20Forces">Israel Defense Forces</a> Chamber Orchestra. Shohat has composed numerous <a href="Symphony">symphonies</a>, <a href="concerto">concerto</a>s, <a href="opera">opera</a>s, and chamber and solo compositions.
Awards and recognition.
Shohat was named Knight in the <a href="Ordre%20des%20Arts%20et%20des%20Lettres">Order of Arts and Letters</a> of France in 2009.
